p: A total of 157 air samples were collected using AGI-30 (All Glass Impinger) placed in the middle of the pig farm, at 1.5 m from the ground, using 20 mL phosphate buffered saline (PBS) sampling medium, with a flow velocity of 12.5 L/min for 40 min [ 22, 23]. Virus was detected in samples using the RT-qPCR methods [ 24]. Serum samples from pigs (n=200) and pig farm staff (n=23) displaying flu-like symptoms were collected and processed by the local centers for disease control (CDC) [ 25].
